turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I'll meet you on the turnpike.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: I'm scared.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: I have to go back.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Okay. Maybe tomorrow.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: I have to go back now.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: We'll talk about it in the car.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: I have to go back, Craig. Being inside did something to me. All of a sudden everything made sense. I knew who I was.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: You weren't you. You were John Malkovich.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: I was, wasn't I?  I was John fucking Malkovich!  Take me back, Craig.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Tomorrow. We're late for Lester.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Lotte! Why aren't you at the pet shop?

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: Fuck pets. Is this your partner? I had to come back and do the Malkovich ride again. Fuck everything else. Is this her?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Why aren't you at work?

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: I've been going over and over my experience last night. It was amazing.  I've decided I'm a transsexual. Isn't that the craziest thing?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: What, are you nuts? That's Oprah talking.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: Everything felt right for the first time. I need to go back to make sure, then if the feeling is still there. I'm going to speak to Dr. Feldman about sexual reassignment surgery.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: This is absurd. Besides Feldman's an allergist. If you're going to do something, do it right.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: How was it?

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: I have to go back tonight. At eight Exactly.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: Don't crowd me, Craig.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: So how was it? What was he doing?

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: Oh, you know, not a lot. Just hanging around his apartment. I think he must be a lonely man.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: You see, men can feel unfulfilled, too. I'm glad you're realizing that. You shouldn't be so quick to assume that switching bodies would be the answer to all your problems.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: You're right. You know I was thinking that we should have Maxine over for dinner. Since you two are partners and all. It might be a nice gesture.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I don't know. There's some tension between us. I'd hate to expose you to that.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: It'll be okay. I'll fix my lasagna. WeÂ’ll smoke a joint.  Tensions will melt away.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: Did you know that Eskimos have not one, but fifty words for snow. It's because they have so much of it.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: After dinner I'll show you my puppets.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I'm moving. Remember? What's with the hooded cloak?

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: Nothing. Don't go, Craig. I've been thinking. Let's try to work this out. We've got so much history.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: You should feed your animals. They're looking peaked.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: I'm getting rid of the fucking animals.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: I'm getting rid of the animals. I've lost interest. Besides, they're standing between you and me.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: No they're not.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: You've always hated the animals.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: You've always loved the animals.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: I'm giving them up. I've changed. I've found a new focus.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: Us, of course.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: What about Maxine?

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: Fuck Maxine.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: We wish.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: You were him last night, weren't you?

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: And he was with her.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: We love her, Craig. I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: We?

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: Me and John.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Don't forget me.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: Well, you have the Maxine action figure to play with.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: I'm sorry. That was nasty.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Life is confusing, isn't it?

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: Sometimes we're forced to make hard decisions.  I'd like for us to stay together, Craig. You know, platonically, if that's possible. I truly value our friendship.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I feel that somehow my parents never prepared me to make this particular decision. Not that I blame them. How could they know? Today's world is so complicated.  No. I have to go away now. I'm sorry, Lotte. I'm so sorry.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: I'm your Goddamn wife. Once you vowed to cherish me forever. Now you hold a gun to my head?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Yeah, well welcome to the nineties.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: Suck my dick!

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Shut up!

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Tell her you need to see her.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: You bastard.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Tell her, what the hell, close early today, live dangerously.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: What the hell, darling. Close early today, live dangerously.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: It was lovely being you being Malkovich, my dear. I'd never seen the passionate side of sweet Maxine before, or her actual tits for that matter. If only, I've been thinking to myself, if only I could actually feel what Malkovich feels, rather than just see what he sees... And then, dare I say it, if only I could control his arms, his legs, his pelvis, and make them do my bidding.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: It'll never happen, fuckface.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Ah, but you're forgetting one thing, Lambchop.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I'm a puppeteer.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: Once this was a relationship based on love. Now you have me in a cage with a monkey and a gun to my head.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Things change. Anyway, you gave up your claim to that love the first time you stuck your dick in Maxine.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: You fell in love with her first.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Yeah but I didn't do anything about it. Out of respect for our marriage.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: You didn't do anything about it out of respect for the fact that she wouldn't let you near her with a ten foot pole, which is, by the way, about nine feet, nine inches off the mark anyway.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: That's true. Oh, God, Lotte, what have I become? My wife in a cage with a monkey. A gun in my hand. Betrayal in my heart.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: Maybe this is what you've always been, Craig, you just never faced it before.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Perhaps you're right. I can't let you go though. Too much has happened. You're my ace in the hole.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: I need a shower.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I'm sorry. Oh God, I'm sorry. I'm some kind of monster. I'm the guy you read about in the paper and go, "he's some kind of monster."

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: You're not a monster, Craig. Just a confused man.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I love you so much.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: My God!

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I'm so glad you're safe. You look really wonderful.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: I'm in love. For the first time. It's funny, but when it happens to you, there's no question.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: He's a lucky man.  Do I know him?

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: It's Elijah.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: The iguana?

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: The monkey.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Oh, right. As long as you're happy. I'm sure he's a better lover than I ever was.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: A better friend.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I'm sorry for everything.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: It's okay, Craig. It all worked out, in an odd sort of way.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: You came up here looking for the portal?

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: Yeah. I was going to kill him from the inside.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: And yourself too in the process. God, you're so beautiful. Why couldn't I see that before?

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: You saw it once. Now you see it again. That's life, isn't it? And you were up here to try the same thing, weren't you?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I suppose. But they got here first, the lousy bastards. So now it's all over, I guess.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: I don't know. There's a small community of us. We have a place they don't know about. We're happy. We'll keep trying to figure out a way. Come stay with us. Join the struggle.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: You'll have me, after all I've done to you?

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: People make mistakes.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I'm through with puppets, Lotte. I just want you to know that.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I'd like to be a farmer. I want to help things grow, to encourage life. Do you and your friends need a farmer?

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: Sure. We could really use a farmer. We'd be grateful for the help.  Also, I think, you know, if you wouldn't mind too terribly, a little puppet show every once in a while, would do a lot to lift our spirits. You know, if you wouldn't mind too terribly.

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: Maxine...

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I can't believe it. This is too good to be true.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Holy shit, yes!

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: Holy shit, yes!

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Holy shit! He said what I said!

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: Holy shit! He said what I said!

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Mr. Malkovich, my name is Craig Schwartz. I can explain. We operate a little business her that... simulates, for our clientele, the experience of... being you, actually.

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: Simulates?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Sure, after a fashion.

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: Let me try.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: You? Why I'm sure it would pale in comparison to the actual experience.

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: Let me try!

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: So how was it?

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: That... was... no... simulation.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I know. I'm sorry...

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: I have been to the dark side. I have seen a world that no man should ever see.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Really? For most people it's a rather pleasant experience. What exactly did you...

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: This portal is mine and must be sealed up forever. For the love of God.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: With all respect, sir, I discovered that portal. Its my livelihood.

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: It's my head, Schwartz, and I'll see you in court!

turns.speaker: FLORIS
turns.text: Welcome to LesterCorp. May we meet your filing needs?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: No, uh, my name is Craig Schwartz. I have an interview with Mr. Lester.

turns.speaker: FLORIS
turns.text: Please have a seat, Mr. Juarez...

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Schwartz.

turns.speaker: FLORIS
turns.text: Pardon?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Schwartz.

turns.speaker: FLORIS
turns.text: I'm sorry, I'm afraid I have no idea what you're saying right now.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: My name is Schwartz.

turns.speaker: FLORIS
turns.text: Money, Miss Warts?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Forget it.

turns.speaker: FLORIS
turns.text: Mr. Juarez?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: FLORIS
turns.text: Yex?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I said "yes."

turns.speaker: FLORIS
turns.text: You suggest what? I have no time for piddling suggestions from mumbling job applicants, my good man. Besides, Dr. Lester will see you now. I think that's what he said.

turns.speaker: FLORIS
turns.text: You're not like the other boys we've had here. Granted, I can't understand what you're saying either, but your soft palette resonates tremendously well and you never ever constrict your epiglottis.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I am a trained performer.

turns.speaker: FLORIS
turns.text: Music to my ears! Whatever you said. Speak, speak, speak, my magnificent friend, speak!

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Floris, you're very nice, but I'm afraid IÂ’m in love with somebody else.

turns.speaker: FLORIS
turns.text: I'm afraid I... have no idea what you are saying... you bastard!

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Come in, Mr. Juarez. I'd stand, but, well, you know.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Actually, my name is Craig Schwartz, Dr. Lester.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Security.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: No, it's okay, sir. Just a mixup with your secretary.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: She's not my secretary. She's what they call an executive liaison, and I'm not banging her, if that's what youÂ’re implying.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Not at all, Dr. Lester. I simply misspoke.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Tell me, Dr. Schwartz, what do you feel you can bring to LesterCorp?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Well, sir, I'm an excellent filer.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: You think so, eh? Which comes first, L or... Glooph?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Glooph is not a letter, sir.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Damn, you are good. I tried to trick you. Okay, put these in order.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: You don't have a speech impediment, Dr. Lester.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Flattery will get you everywhere, my boy. But I'm afraid I have to trust Floris on this one. You see, she has her doctorate in speech impedimentology from Case Western. Perhaps you've read her memoirs, "I can't understand a word any of you are saying."

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Pity, it tells it like it is. That's why the eastern, read Jewish, publishing establishment won't touch it. That's a quote from the book jacket. George Will, I think.  I apologize if you can't understan a word I'm saying, Dr. Schwartz.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: No. I understand perfectly.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Thank you for being kind enough to lie. You see, I've been very lonely in my isolated tower of indecipherable speech. You're hired. Any questions?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Just one. Why is this floor so short?

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Low overhead, m'boy. We pass the savings on to you.  But seriously, that's all covered in orientation.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Don't toy with Floris, Schwartz. Why, if I were eighty years younger, I'd box your ears.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I wasn't toying with her, sir. I was just... How old are you?

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: One hundred and five. Carrot juice.  Lot's of it. I swear, it's almost not worth it. I piss orange. Oh, and I, have to piss sitting down... like a godamn girly... every fifteen minutes. But nobody wants to die, Schwartz.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I'll keep that in mind, sir.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: No sir-e-bob, I don't die. But what I do is get older, wrinkled like a former plum that's become the wrinkled prune you see before you. Oh, to be a young man again, maybe then Floris would care for me.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: The elderly have so much to offer, sir. They are our link with history.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: I don't want to be your godamn link, damn you. I want to feel Floris' naked thighs against my own. I want to know passion. I want my body to inspire lust in that beautiful, complex woman. I want her to shiver in a spasm of ecstasy when I penetrate her. Oh, God, the agony of the flesh, Schwartz.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Dr. Lester, while I am flattered that you share your feelings with me, I believe perhaps the workplace is not the most suitable environment for this type of discussion.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: All right. Meet me at the Juicy-Juice Juice Bar after work today and I'll spill my goddamn guts for you.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Imagine a room full of women. Nubile, blonde, wet with desire, Schwartz. A harem, if you will. Me in leather. A harness, if you like. I am the object of this desire, and all eyes are on me as I speak. Â“Ladies,Â” I begin. Â“I am the love god, Eros. I intoxicate you. My spunk is to you manna from heaven...

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Dr. Lester, it's been really fascinating, but I'm afraid I have to get home to my wife now.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Wife, huh? I'd love to meet her, Craig.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Yessir.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Shall we say dinner on Friday. Just the two of us?  You can come too if you like, Schwartz.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: That's sounds fine, sir. Gotta run.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Dr. Lester. . .

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Ah, Craig. Just the fellow I wanted to see.  Juicer! Easy as pie. Just keep your fingers clear of the blade, and never, never use it while bathing in a tub full of water.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Dr. Lester, I have a question. I was in that vacant office down the hall and I stumbled upon a little door and....

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Ah. yes, the little door.  There is a short film on the little door in the orientation room in exactly two minutes. If you hurry, you'll just make it.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Thank you, sir.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Dr. Lester...

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: More beet-spinach juice, my friend?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: No thank you sir. It's delicious, though. I just wanted to thank you for the opportunity to work at LesterCorp, but I'm afraid I'm going to have to tender my resignation effectively immediately.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: I see. Are you unhappy at our little company?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: No sir, not at all. It's just that I'm going to open my own business and...

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: And what sort of business will this be? If you don't mind my asking.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Uh, import-export. Olive oil. Right on 7 1/2 actually.  In the vacant office. So we'll still be seeing each other.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: The vacant office. I see. Olive oil. Interesting. Be warned, Schwartz, there are certain Â“doorsÂ” which should never be opened.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: You're making a big mistake, Schwartz.  Ma'am

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Dr. Lester, I don't know what you're talking about.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: There are rules, boy, procedures, etiquette. This is not a toy. I've been waiting seventy years to utilize this room, grooming myself, quietly setting the stage, performing ablutions, paying tribute, seeing all his motion pictures again and again. Worshipping, Schwartz, worshipping properly.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: You're insane.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: I am not alone. There are others. We are legion. You will pay for this blasphemy. You will pay dearly.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Moving story.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Yes. Unfortunately it's bullshit. The real story of 7 1/2 is so evil that it could never be revealed to Americans raised on sitcoms and happy news anchors.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Is that true?

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Well, truth is for suckers, isn't it?.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Listen. I'm Craig Schwartz, just starting out at LesterCorp.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: How dreary - to be - Somebody / How public - like a Frog / To tell one's name - the livelong June / To an admiring Bog!

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Emily Dickinson.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: I wouldn't know.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Yes, well...

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: You know, I've been thinking about what you said yesterday, about the orientation film being a cover-up. I think you're on to something.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: And fifty other lines to get into a girl's pants.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: No, really.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: You know, if you ever got me, you wouldn't have a clue what to do with me. That's the thing, Romeo.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I just wanted to say Â“hi.Â”  Did you know I still don't know your name or where you work?

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: How about this, if I can guess your first name within three tries, you have to come out for a drink with me tonight.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Great.  Buuuhhppaahhhhnnn. . . . . Muhhhahhhhh. . . . . ahhhnnnaaa. . nollltuuukkkaaaaralllll. . . tashabararassssssuuuuusaaaaaaa. . . nnnnnnnaaaaaannnnnnnnncccccceeeeeee Mwaaaaaa. . . . .Mahhhhhkkkkk. . . sssseeeeeen. Maxine?

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Who told you?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I'm right?

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Who told you?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: That's incredible! Nobody told me! I swear! It's kismet. Maxine! It's a beautiful name. There's a psychic connection. Don't you see? It was meant to be! Maxine! Maxine! Maxine! I will shout it from the rooftops!

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Somebody told you.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Oh, Maxine, nobody told me. Maxine, Maxine. It just came out of me like a song, Maxine. A beautiful crazy, song, Maxine. Maxine. Maxine!

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: I am dubious, but I don't welsh. Meet me at The Stuck Pig. Seven o'clock. You're late, I walk. So help me, if I find out you cheated.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Maxine.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Made it. Maxine. Maxine, Maxine, Maxine.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Just.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Buy you a drink, Maxine?

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: You married?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Yeah. But enough about me.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: What'll you have?

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: The usual, Barry.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I'll have, like, a beer. Like a Budweiser, or something.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I like you. I don't know what it is exactly.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: My tits?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: No, no, it's your energy or your attitude or the way you carry yourself or...

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Christ, you're not a fag are you? Because I don't want to be wasting my time.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: That's the usual?

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: DonÂ’t let the girly shit fool you. It'd blow your shorts off.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: IÂ’m not a homosexual. I just like women for more than their bodies. I guess you could say I'm the new American male.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: You're a fag or a liar.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I mean, I am really attracted to you.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: I mean, I am really attracted to you. Jesus, you are a fag. We can share recipes, if you like, Darlene.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: No, wait! I like your tits.  I love your tits. I want to fuck you.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Good. Now we're getting somewhere.  Not a chance.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: So, tell me about yourself. If you can get your mind out of the gutter long enough, dog-boy.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Well, I'm a puppeteer...

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: You're not someone I could get interested in. Craig. You play with dolls.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Puppets. Maxine. It's the idea of being inside someone else, feeling what they feel, seeing what they see...

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Yikes.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Please, let me explain.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: It's just, and I've never done this before, Maxine, but it's just that I feel something for you. I've never felt this before for anyone, not even my wife. My future is with you, Maxine.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: You might want to check those tarot cards one more time.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Don't you want to know what happened to me?

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: This is important!

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: It better be.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: There's a tiny door in that empty office. It's a portal, Maxine. It takes you inside John Malkovich. You see the world through John Malkovich's eyes, then, after about fifteen minutes, you're spit out into a ditch on the side of The New Jersey Turnpike.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Sounds delightful. Who the fuck is John Malkovich?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: He's an actor. One of the great American actors of the 20th century.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: What's he been in?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Lots of things. He's very well respected. That jewel thief movie, for example. The point is that this is a very odd thing, supernatural, for lack of a better word. It raises all sorts of philosophical questions about the nature of self, about the existence of the soul. Am I me? Is Malkovich Malkovich? Was the Buddha right, is duality an illusion? Do you see what a can of worms this portal is? I don't think I can go on living my life as I have lived it. There's only one thing to do. Let's get married right away.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Is this Malkovich fellow appealing?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Yes, of course. He's a celebrity.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Good. We'll sell tickets.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Tickets to Malkovich?

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Exactly. Two hundred dollars a pop.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: But there's something profound here, Maxine, we can't exploit it.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Fine. I'll do it myself. I was going to offer a partnership to you, but this way it's more money for me.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: You wanted to be partners with me?

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Sure. It'd be fun.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Really?  But, Maxine, can of worms! End of the world! Illusory nature of existence!

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: I'll protect you, Dollface.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Okay. Here it is.  Ever want to be someone else? Now you can. No kidding. Only two hundred dollars for fifteen minutes. Visit J.M. Inc., Mertin-Flemmer Building. etc., etc.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Sounds good. Oblique but intriguing. Phone it in.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Craig, I just don't find you attractive. And, Lotte, I'm smitten with you, but only when you're in Malkovich. When I looked into his eyes last night, I could feel you peering out. Behind the stubble and the too-prominent brow and the male pattern baldness, I sensed your feminine longing peering out, and it just slew me.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: My God.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: This is amazing! We're gonna be rich!

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: So unbolt the fucking door, Einstein.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: You're late.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Are you torturing me on purpose?

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: I've fallen in love.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I don't think so. I've fallen in love. This is what people who've fallen in love look like.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: You picked the unrequited variety. Very bad for the skin.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: You're evil, Maxine.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Do you have any idea what its like to have two people look at you with total lust and devotion through the same pair of eyes? No I don't suppose you would. It's quite a thrill, Craig.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: You're glowing again.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: A girl has a right to glow if she wants. It's in the fucking constitution.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Lotte, this is so good...

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Move right hand across her left breast now. Move right hand across her left breast now. Move right hand across her left breast now.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Lotte? Is that you?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Yes, yes, sweetheart, yes!

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Let him try.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Of course, right this way, Mr. Malkovich. Compliments of the house.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: What happens when a man climbs through his own portal?

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: How the hell would I know? I wasn't a philosophy major.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: But I gotta go now. I've got to go be Johnny.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: J.M. Inc. Be all that someone...

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Hello, Don.

turns.speaker: DON
turns.text: Hello. Wendy.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Don, I was wondering, do you know why our workplace has such low ceilings?

turns.speaker: DON
turns.text: It's an interesting story, Wendy. Many years ago in the late 1800's, James Mertin, an Irish ship captain looking to invest in the future of our great country, came to this town and decided to erect an office building.

turns.speaker: DON
turns.text: So that's the story of 7 1/2. Since the rents are considerably lower this floor has been adopted by businesses which for one reason or another are forced to cut corners After all... the overhead is low! Ha ha ha!

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Ha ha ha!

turns.speaker: DON
turns.text: Hi. Wendy! What're you up to in this vacant office.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Well, Don, I peeked in here, even though I know it's against floor policy. and I discovered that there's a little tiny door in here. Isn't it cute? It's almost like a little dolly's door. I wonder what itÂ’s for.

turns.speaker: DON
turns.text: That's right, Wendy, it is against floor policy, but as long as you're here, let me tell you what I know about our cute little door friend. Many years ago, this very office was occupied by a kindly old watchmaker named Mr. White.

turns.speaker: ELIJAH
turns.text: You've got to tell Craig what's going on. He must never leave Malkovich.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: I'm glad you learned sign language, Elijah, but I'm tired of your nagging. I'm tired of this conversation. I'm tired period. What has the world ever done for me that I should feel personally responsible for saving it?

turns.speaker: ELIJAH
turns.text: It is better to light one candle than curse the darkness. I learned that from you.

turns.speaker: ELIJAH
turns.text: Must you take this terrible demon on yourself, my love?

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: Yes. I'm the only one. I have to enter Malkovich and destroy him from the inside. If not me, who?

turns.speaker: ELIJAH
turns.text: If there was any way I could go in your place. But I'm only a monkey and...

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: Hush, sweetheart.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: I'll be with you always, my friends. Who knows, maybe if I'm lucky, I'll rejoin you with wings and a beak.

turns.speaker: ELIJAH
turns.text: Wings and a halo, my darling. Wings and a halo.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ERROLL
turns.text: Long term psychic or physiological repercussions?

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: No. Don't be an ass.

turns.speaker: ERROLL
turns.text: Can I be anyone I want?

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: You can be John Malkovich.

turns.speaker: ERROLL
turns.text: Well that's perfect. My second choice. Ah, this is wonderful. Too good to be true! You see, I'm a sad man. Sad and fat and alone. Oh, I've tried all the diets, my friends. Lived for a year on nothing but imitation mayonnaise. Did it work? You be the judge. But Malkovich! King of New York! Man about town! Most eligible bachelor! Bon Vivant! The Schopenhauer of the 20th century! Thin man extraordinaire!

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Two hundred dollars, please.

turns.speaker: ERROLL
turns.text: Yes. Yes. A thousand times, yes!

turns.speaker: FLEMMER
turns.text: Boy, this is a toughie. To be honest, I didn't anticipate this.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: And as I said, sir, we can't very well exert physical persuasion upon the sacred vessel Malkovich.

turns.speaker: FLEMMER
turns.text: Right, Lester. I heard you the first time. I'm not a dummy.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Didn't mean to imply that you were, sir.

turns.speaker: FLEMMER
turns.text: Look, I'm going back to my house to ponder this. So stay calm and keep track of Schwartz's comings and goings. Oh, and somebody dispose of Schwartz's wife, will you?  Nice to meet you all.

turns.speaker: FLEMMER
turns.text: Have a seat. I wracking my brain over this Malkovich thing.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: We saw his show at the Luxor last night.

turns.speaker: FLEMMER
turns.text: Vegas? What'd you think?

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: The kid's got talent. You've never seen Malkovich like this. Schwartz had him up there singing and dancing. Impressions.

turns.speaker: FLEMMER
turns.text: Impressions? Those are hard.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Very talented son of a bitch. Too bad we can't kill him.

turns.speaker: FLEMMER
turns.text: I suppose I could come to him in a dream. I don't know. That's the best I can think of right now.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: A scary dream?

turns.speaker: FLEMMER
turns.text: No, a sexy dream. Of course, a scary dream.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: I like that.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: How'd it go? Did you say the philodendron gets water or no?

turns.speaker: FLEMMER
turns.text: No, for God's sake, I just watered it yesterday.  It almost went well. I gave a pretty good dream, but circumstances arose.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: What kind of circumstances?

turns.speaker: FLEMMER
turns.text: Maxine says she'll leave him if he leaves Malkovich, plus he's been challenged to a puppet-duel by Mantini.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: The Great Mantini?

turns.speaker: FLEMMER
turns.text: No, the Mediocre Mantini. Of course the Great Mantini!

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Oh, he's good! Great, actually. I saw him do "Tru" with his sixty foot Robert Morse puppet. Sensational.

turns.speaker: FLEMMER
turns.text: But I think I have another plan.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Do tell. I love a good plan.

turns.speaker: FLEMMER
turns.text: Why are you being like this?

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: I missed you. I'm sorry. Tell me the plan.

turns.speaker: FLEMMER
turns.text: Well, if Mantini wins, Schwartz will leave Malkovich, right? So, if he needs it, I help Mantini's performance a bit, give him an edge. Spice up the show.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Can you do that? I mean, do you know anything about puppetry?

turns.speaker: FLEMMER
turns.text: I am the Devil, Lester. I think I can handle it.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: I was just asking. No disrespect intended.

turns.speaker: FLEMMER
turns.text: Fine. Let's drop it.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Fine. I mean, it's not like I was doubting you, it's just that I know puppetry is a skill that takes a long time to acquire.

turns.speaker: FLEMMER
turns.text: Fine. I'm not mad. Let's just drop it.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Fine. Your mail's on the kitchen table. Mostly junk. Oh, there's a letter from Alex Trebek.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Floris, get Guinness on the phone.

turns.speaker: FLORIS
turns.text: Gehginnis ondah foam?

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Forget it.

turns.speaker: FLORIS
turns.text: Fork ah did?

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Fine woman, Floris. I don't know how she puts up with this damn speech impediment of mine.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Yes, my dear?

turns.speaker: FLORIS
turns.text: Someone names A Lot of Warts on line two.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Thank you, Floris.

turns.speaker: FLORIS
turns.text: Think, Jew florist?

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Good morning, Lotte!

turns.speaker: HARRY S. TRUMAN PUPPET
turns.text: Do you dream often?

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: Do you?

turns.speaker: HARRY S. TRUMAN PUPPET
turns.text: It's my job to ask the questions. Yours to answer them.

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: Says who?

turns.speaker: HARRY S. TRUMAN PUPPET
turns.text: Says me. Do you dream often?

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: Do you?

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: It's like nothing I've ever felt before. I think I'm going crazy.

turns.speaker: KEVIN BACON
turns.text: I'm sure you're not going crazy.

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: Kevin, I'm telling you... it was like nothing I've...

turns.speaker: KEVIN BACON
turns.text: Yeah yeah yeah. Yadda yadda yadda. Were you stoned?

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: Yes, but you see, someone else was talking through my mouth.

turns.speaker: KEVIN BACON
turns.text: You were stoned. Case closed. End of story. How hot is this babe?

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: I think it might've been this Lotte woman talking through me. Maxine likes to call me Lotte.

turns.speaker: KEVIN BACON
turns.text: Ouch. Now that's hot. She's using you to channel some dead lesbian lover. Let me know when you're done with her. This is my type of chick.

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: I'm done with her now. Tonight really creeped me out.

turns.speaker: KEVIN BACON
turns.text: You're crazy to let go of a chick who calls you Lotte. I tell you that as a friend.

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: I don't know anything about her. What if she's some sort of witch or something?

turns.speaker: KEVIN BACON
turns.text: All the better. Hey, Hot Lesbian Witches, next Geraldo, buddy boy. Ha ha ha.

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: I gotta know the truth, Kevin.

turns.speaker: KEVIN BACON
turns.text: The truth is for suckers, Johnny-Boy.

turns.speaker: WOMAN #1
turns.text: You don't look a day over one hundred and five, Captain. What's your secret?

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Lots of carrot juice, little lady. That, and a deal with the Devil.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Anybody else?

turns.speaker: WOMAN #1
turns.text: Do we get to wear a crown?

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: But of course.

turns.speaker: WOMAN #1
turns.text: Count me in.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Good. I think its time to beckon Mr. Flemmer. Perhaps He can help us out of this pickle.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Tell me, Lotte, can you understand a word I'm saying?

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: Yes, of course, Dr. Lester.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Oh, be still my heart.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: Dr. Lester, would you point me toward the restroom?

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: With immense pleasure, my dear. Down that hall, ninth door on the left. Watch the step down. It's sunken, you know.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: I'm getting divorced.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: No you mustn't, my child.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: But why, Son of Malkovich?

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: We need you on the inside, my child. To report on his comings and goings, and if need be, to... destroy him...  ...for lack of a better word.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: I blew it, Dr. Lester.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: You followed your heart, my child, and that is not necessarily a bad thing.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: But now we've lost access to Craig.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: My child, I don't think its a great mystery what Craig's up to.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: You know I think it pays to leave juice-making to the trained professionals. You look terrible, my dear.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: Craig stole Maxine from me, Dr. Lester.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Hmmm, a lesbian, are you? I must inform you that I find that highly arousing.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: No, you don't understand. I've been inside Malkovich when I'm with Maxine...

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: What?! That is not allowed. My God, you are supposed to be one of us. You know you must never partake of Malkovich by yourself!

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: No, I didn't know that.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Oh, didn't anyone show you the indoctrination video?

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Oh, sorry. Right this way.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Aaaahhhh, the portal!

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: You bastard!

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: No! Don't harm the vessel!

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: It's Craig in there, I can tell.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: I understand, but we must protect the vessel at all costs.  Please, Craig, please step aside and allow us to have what is rightfully ours.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: Thank you all for your efforts, but I'm afraid we can no longer get into Malkovich through the portal.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: Why not? I need to get in there!

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: I'm not certain, my dear, but I believe your husband has somehow psychically diverted the route.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: That bastard! I'll gladly dispose of him in the name of the order, Son of Malkovich.

turns.speaker: LESTER
turns.text: I'm afraid that no physical harm must come to him as long as he inhabits the vessel.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Yes, hello, I wanted to place an ad.  Hi, are you Craig's wife?

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: Yes, Hi.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: Hi. Have you done Malkovich yet?

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Hi, uh.  Hi. I wanted to place an ad. Yes. "Ever want to be someone else?" No, that's the ad, but let's talk about you in a minute. "Ever want to be someone else? Now you can. No kidding..."

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: Don't stand in the way of my actualization as a man, Craig.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Let her go, Craig. I mean Â“him."

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: And the funny thing is. Mr. Malkovich, my voice is probably the least intriguing thing about me.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: I've never been looked at like this by a woman.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Ah.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: After that I'll introduce you to my favorite monkey, Elijah. He's got an ulcer, due to a suppressed childhood trauma. But we're getting to the bottom of it.  Psychotherapy.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: I have to see you. Can you call him and invite us over?

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: Give me one hour to get inside him Exactly.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: Oh my darling. Oh my sweetheart.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: I love you, Lotte.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: Maxine...

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: J.M. Inc. Be all that someone else can be.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: I have to see you.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Sweetie! Oh, but we can't. It's business hours. I need to keep the membranous tunnel open for paying customers.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: We have to meet.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: One hour.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: Maxine! Listen:  It hasn't been me in John the last three times. Craig's had me locked up in the apartment. He made me call you at gunpoint. It's been him! Oh, God, it's been him!

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Really? Well, you know, he's quite good. I'm surprised. Anyway, I have a session with Malkovich I have to attend. I'll speak with you soon.

turns.speaker: LOTTE
turns.text: But Maxine, I thought it was me you loved.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: I thought so too, doll. I guess we were mistaken.

turns.speaker: MANTINI
turns.text: Hello, Schwartz. I saw your show.

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: Did you see the reviews?

turns.speaker: MANTINI
turns.text: Yeah, I saw them

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: Because if you missed any, I just happen to have copies here you can take with you when you leave now.

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: She's not available.

turns.speaker: MANTINI
turns.text: We'll see, Schwartz. We'll see.

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: How do we do that?

turns.speaker: MANTINI
turns.text: A friendly competition, if you will. Your Malkovich puppet and my Harry S. Truman puppet appear opposite each other in a play. Not some Vegas Burly-Q pyrotechnics, but a real play that requires actual acting. The audience decides who is more deserving of the title. The losing puppeteer bows out graciously. Goes back to obscurity as a file clerk.

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: What's the play?

turns.speaker: MANTINI
turns.text: Say... "Equus"? It's got everything.

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: Never heard of it.

turns.speaker: MANTINI
turns.text: Broadway's finest three hours. It's about the suppression of the individual. Conformity as God in modern society.

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: Sounds boring. Are there any songs?

turns.speaker: MANTINI
turns.text: Nothing but acting to hide behind, buddy-boy.

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: I'm not afraid. I toured for a year with the National Puppet Company's production of "Long Day's Journey Into Night."

turns.speaker: MANTINI
turns.text: Great then.

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: Is there dancing?

turns.speaker: MANTINI
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: Who needs dancing?

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Mr. Malkovich?

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: Who's calling?

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: You don't know me, but I'm a great admirer of yours.

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: How'd you get this number?

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: It's just that I fantasize about you and, well, speaking to you now has gotten me sort of excited and...

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: Can I get you a drink?

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Whatever you're having.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Thanks so much for coming over.

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: Oh, I'm really glad you called.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: So, do you enjoy being an actor?

turns.speaker: MALKOVICH
turns.text: Oh sure. It's very rewarding...
